newsitem.title: USA: Netscape plans stand-alone Navigator - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Netscape plans stand-alone Navigator - WSJ.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp will introduce a stand-alone version of Navigator, its popular Internet-browser software, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing sources close to the project.
Netscape officials declined to comment, pending a conference call scheduled for this morning, the paper said in its electronic edition on Monday.
The sources told the newspaper that Netscape will offer the software -- Navigator 4.0 -- via distribution deals with IBM and other companies, including Novell and Sun Microsystems.
The company also intends to incorporate its new news and information product, Netcaster, in the software, the paper said.
The move is an attempt to slow inroads by Microsoft in taking a larger share of the market for Internet-browsing software, the paper said.
